item.title: Clo add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Clo add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "It is a fair, even-handed, noble adjustment of things, that while there is infection in disease and sorrow, there is nothing in the world so irresistibly contagious as laughter and good humour." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Clo add a quote by Elizabeth Barrett Browning
item.description: "Earth's crammed with heaven... But only he who sees, takes off his shoes." -- Elizabeth Barrett Browning

item.title: Clo add a quote by Elizabeth Barrett Browning
item.description: "You're something between a dream and a miracle." -- Elizabeth Barrett Browning

item.title: Clo add a quote by Elizabeth Barrett Browning
item.description: "No man can be called friendless who has God and the companionship of good books." -- Elizabeth Barrett Browning

item.title: Clo add a quote by Elizabeth Barrett Browning
item.description: "Why, what is to live? Not to eat and drink and breathe,—but to feel the life in you down all the fibres of being, passionately and joyfully." -- Elizabeth Barrett Browning

item.title: Clo add a quote by Elizabeth Barrett Browning
item.description: "Earth's crammed with heaven, And every common bush afire with God, But only he who sees takes off his shoes; The rest sit round and pluck blackberries." -- Elizabeth Barrett Browning

item.title: Clo add a quote by Elizabeth Barrett Browning
item.description: "I love you not only for what you are, but for what I am when I am with you. I love you not only for what you have made of yourself, but for what you are making of me. I love you for the part of me that you bring out." -- Elizabeth Barrett Browning

item.title: Clo add a quote by Elizabeth Barrett Browning
item.description: "Books, books, books! I had found the secret of a garret room Piled high with cases in my father’s name; Piled high, packed large,--where, creeping in and out Among the giant fossils of my past, Like some small nimble mouse between the ribs Of a mastodon, I nibbled here and there At this or that box, pulling through the gap, In heats of terror, haste, victorious joy, The first book first. And how I felt it beat Under my pillow, in the morning’s dark, An hour before the sun would let me read! My books!" -- Elizabeth Barrett Browning

item.title: Clo add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "He allowed himself to be swayed by his conviction that human beings are not born once and for all on the day their mothers give birth to them, but that life obliges them over and over again to give birth to themselves." -- Gabriel García Márquez
